Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
My thoughts on the comment below are that within 10k years, one would expect a civilisation to either die out, or start increasing tiers on the Kardashev scale. Meaning that at some point, all the energy on Earth won't be enough.
```EmmanuelToday at 9:44 AM
No need, man, this planet is limitless for like 10k years.
In 10k years we can talk about limited resources, not today.```

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I agree that there are plenty of uninhabited places on Earth for people to live. Also, currently, we have enough energy to survive.

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content:
Are you making the point that compared to back then, the world had enough energy to sustain 10k years until now?
I suppose if we send ourselves back generations of technological and societal advancements. 10k years ago, sharpening a rock into something that would inflict damage was a massive technological advancement. Today, creating blockchain and AI are the equivalent. How much energy has the creation of blockchain used in comparison to sharpening a rock?

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: I am also using the rock as a guess of what they would have been doing back then. Maybe it was skinning animals, or animal husbandry? I dunno. The comparison still has relevance.
